name: ClpHelperFunctions
brief: BLAS-1 style dense vector operations for Clp

algorithms.name:
Dense BLAS-1 Operations (AXPY, Dot, Norms)
Non-templated dense array operations optimized for LP use. These exist
separately from CoinDenseVector to enable architecture-specific optimization
without template overhead (per JJF's design note).

Basic operations (double and CoinWorkDouble variants):
- maximumAbsElement(): L-infinity norm (max |x_i|)
- setElements(): Fill array with constant
- multiplyAdd(): y = a1*x + a2*y (AXPY variant)
- innerProduct(): x'y dot product
- getNorms(): Simultaneous L1 and L2 norm computation

Extended precision support (COIN_LONG_WORK):
When enabled, provides long double versions for extra precision in
numerically sensitive computations (e.g., basis factorization).

PDCO helper functions (when ClpPdco_H defined):
- pdxxxmerit(): Merit function for Newton's method
- pdxxxresid1(): Primal-dual residuals
- pdxxxresid2(): Complementarity residuals
- pdxxxstep(): Line search step length

ClpTraceDebug: Debug assertion macro (active when NDEBUG not defined).

see: ClpPdco for the PDCO interior point method
